title: Teaching union claims extra £4bn for Send overhaul just ‘drop in bucket’ compared with what’s needed – UK politics live
summary_full: Full details of government plans to be published this morning with reforms partly driven by move to contain soaring costsHere is the Department for Education’s news release from overnight about the Send reforms.And this is what it says about how it will spend £4bn improving Send provision in English schools,To dramatically improve the support mainstream schools can provide for children with SEND, and rebuild families’ confidence in the system, the government will:-[NEW] Provide £1.6 bn over three years across every early years setting, school and post-16 setting, equating to thousands of pounds extra every year on top of existing core SEND funding, to run targeted and small group interventions at the earliest signs of children having additional needs Continue reading...
